text: Jonathan Zebina (born 19 July 1978) is a French retired professional footballer. Having started his career as a striker, he played right-back for much of his career before being increasingly used as a centre-back. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National cup League cup Continental Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Cannes 1996–97 Division 1 6 0 1 0 0 0 – 7 0 1997–98 21 0 3 0 1 0 – 25 0 Total 27 0 4 0 1 0 0 0 32 0 Cagliari 1998–99 Serie A 22 0 4 0 – – 26 0 1999–00 26 0 6 0 – – 32 0 Total 48 0 10 0 0 0 0 0 58 0 Roma 2000–01 Serie A 22 0 0 0 – 4 0 26 0 2001–02 24 0 2 0 – 10 0 36 0 2002–03 19 0 4 0 – 8 0 31 0 2003–04 23 1 2 0 – 7 0 32 1 Total 88 1 8 0 0 0 27 0 123 1 Juventus 2004–05 Serie A 24 0 1 0 – 6 0 31 0 2005–06 10 0 2 0 – 2 0 14 0 2006–07 Serie B 24 0 0 0 – – 24 0 2007–08 Serie A 16 0 1 0 – – 17 0 2008–09 8 0 0 0 – 0 0 8 0 2009–10 16 0 1 0 – 5 1 22 1 Total 98 0 5 0 0 0 13 1 116 1 Brescia 2010–11 Serie A 28 0 0 0 – – 28 0 Brest 2011–12 Ligue 1 28 0 0 0 1 0 – 29 0 Toulouse 2012–13 Ligue 1 17 0 1 0 0 0 – 18 0 2013–14 20 0 2 0 1 0 – 23 0 Total 37 0 3 0 1 0 0 0 41 0 Arles-Avignon 2014–15 Ligue 2 6 0 1 0 1 0 – 8 0 Career total 360 1 31 0 4 0 40 1 435 2 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals France 2005 1 0 Total 1 0 ==Honours== Roma *Serie A: 2000–01 *Supercoppa Italiana: 2001 Juventus *Serie B: 2006–07 ==References== ==Other websites== * ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Paris
